docs.text: it would be hard to choose the best american political thriller .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some people would probably pick the manchurian candidate and others ( myself included ) would pick seven days in may .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: both those films were tense exercises in chills .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the two films came out within two years of each other and both were directed by the same man , john frankenheimer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but that was 1962 and 1964 respectively .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for most of the rest of his career frankenheimer has turned out some decent films , but has shown little of the promise that those two thrillers showed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: each of those films had memorable characters and a tense plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they had almost nothing in the way of chases or gunplay .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the thrills all came from the plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ronin is like a film made by another man .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: somewhere behind all the shooting and explosions and car chases there are the rudiments ofa plot , but we see only tiny pieces of it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we get a clue here and one there as to what is going on but j . d . zeik's screenplay is a bit obscure .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film begins explaining that a ronin is a masterless samurai .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when a samurai has failed in the job of protecting his master from death , he becomes a ronin , much like a gunfighter in the american west .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you miss the opening , do not worry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this film will explain again what a ronin is .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sam ( played by robert de niro ) is the modern equivalent of a ronin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is a free agent who seems to have really good instincts about how to stay alive the world of a professional killer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he clearly was in a dangerous business at one time and now he seems to be drifting around on his own somewhere in france .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sam is recruited from a montmartre bar by dierdre ( natascha mcelhone of the truman show ) , an irish woman , to be part of an action to steal a mysterious metal case .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dierdre is very tight-lipped about what is in the case .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sam joins a team of four others : vincent ( jean reno of the professional/leon and mission impossible ) , spence ( sean bean , tv's richard sharpe , and also patriot games and goldeneye ) , and gregor ( stellan skarsgard of breaking the waves and good will hunting ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also along is larry ( skipp suddeth ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the group seems to know their business , particularly sam , but each is in his own way cold and professional with his own field of expertise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their only human side seems to be in tensions among the members of the team .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story is not very easy to follow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is never clear who is double-crossing whom and who is working for whom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: somehow russians ( who may or may not be the russian mafia ) and irish radicals are involved trying to get their hands on a certain metal case .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some very good actors are involved in this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one wonders what they saw in the script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the characters are mostly one-dimensional professional killers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they know their work , and seeing their thought patterns adds some interest to the film , but for this group deep feeling between two people is teaming up with another killer so that neither is killed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: by the end of the film we never really got to know anybody .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe that is the secret of why such good actors took parts , since these are not very demanding characters to create .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in addition to the above characters the film also features jonathan pryce and michael lonsdale ( the latter of moonraker and of the superior thriller the day of the jackal ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a revival of a sort of action film that was popular in the 1960s , i was hoping that there would be something here to grab onto and enjoy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately there are no deep characters , and little to make us care who eventually ends up with the metal case or why they want it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i rate ronin a 4 on the 0 to 10 scale and a 0 on the -4 to +4 scale .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: non-spoiler : incidentally , the tale of the 47 ronin has been filmed multiple times , usually under the title chushingura or as the 47 ronin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also one frequently sees in japanese art the image of a man breaking down a door with a huge mallet .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is the first blow of the 47 ronin .
docs.label: negative
